page.title: 15THE LEWES BY-PASS
page.content: Although demands for a by-pass around Lewes were first made around l935 it was not until the l970's that some- thing was done. Heavy traffic on the A27 trunk road through the town had long been a problem. The large number of old listed buildings made widening the narrow streets difficult. Rapid growth in traffic through Newhaven Port in the l960's increased the urgency of finding a solution. The road crosses the flood plain of the River Ouse on an embankment of crushed chalk dug from the deep cutting made through Kingston Ridge. The 3.4 km long by-pass carries a daily average of over l7,000 vehicles away from the Town. It is now possible to cross the High Street in safety and comparative peace. The South Street Tunnel was completed a few years later,G.B's longest road tunnel not underwater.
